content.description: Sit start 6 feet to the right of the large tree growing into the boulder, to the far left end of the boulder.   Start under the small roof ledge with feet totally underneath, and hands on a small edge rail on the outer portion of the ledges lip. work up through more shallow ledges to top out directly overhead.
content.location: Sit start 6 feet to the right of the large tree growing into the boulder, to the far left end of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit start on the bulge/block feature with the left facing side pull, 7 feet from the large tree that is 4 feet from touching the boulder, standing at the middle of the main, left portion of the boulder.   start with your left high and on a good jug on the upper portion of the left facing side pull, and with your right on a lower, embedded smooth ball like stone. feet underneath the block/bulge. 

  work up through great hands to the top out.
content.location: Sit start on the bulge/block feature with the left facing side pull, 7 feet from the large tree that is 4 feet from touching the boulder, standing at the middle of the main, left portion of the boulder

content.description: Sit start 7 feet from the large tree near the mid-portion of the main boulder face.   start with hands on a large jug/right facing side pull. work up through big hands. when you get the big block with the left facing side pull, traverse to the right through large and small, smooth knobs to a top out that is over the watershed/water groove. the finish is far to the right from the start.
content.location: Sit start 7 feet from the large tree near the mid-portion of the main boulder face.

content.description: Sit start in front of the large tree that is 4 feet away from the mid portion of the main boulder face.   start with hands on the huge block. work up through big hands to the quartz knobs for the top out.
content.location: Sit start in front of the large tree that is 4 feet away from the mid portion of the main boulder face.

content.description: Sit start slightly left of the large left facing block feature, 10 feet from the ingrown tree at the end of the left side of the boulder.   Start very low with hands pinching the lowest lip of the small overhanging roof. toss up to the excellent ledge above, and then high and left to the crimp rail. top out (near of same top out as "star fish")
content.location: Sit start slightly left of the large left facing block feature, 10 feet from the ingrown tree at the end of the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the far left side of the boulder, just to the right of the large tree growing into the boulder.   hands start on the humongous ledge. work up through diminishing large ledges to a slim top out
content.location: Sit start on the far left side of the boulder, just to the right of the large tree growing into the boulder.

content.description:
This is a short, but large in diameter boulder. Several established problems can be found here, mostly all easy. . 

  This boulder isn't as good as most of the rest of the boulders in the boneyard but if these are in your grade range and you're up for a hike and some exploring than why not?
